alert.note: Alert for Hayes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 5:57PM CDT until May 13 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Frenchman Creek near Palisade affecting Hayes County. For the Frenchman Creek...including Palisade...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Frenchman Creek near Palisade. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Flooding begins between Wauneta and Palidade. Some areas of Palisade near Kotter Park will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Friday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feet on 05/31/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 600 AM CDT.
